column4: Anybody point me in the direction of k9copy help? Is there a channel for kde apps?
re k9copy: could the problem just be the particular DVD?
IOW, have you used k9copy successfully on any DVD yet?
I don't think so. I've tried 2 other dvds
hrm, so there's no baseline established yet - I wonder what the problem could be?
do you have that libcss2 thingie installed?
are you interested in AVI output, or does it have to be DVD quality?
I'd actually prefer avi. I only have a 40gb hard drive ^_^
me too ;-)  I *really* have come to like 'dvdrip'...
it is fussy to set up (just a bit), but once you satisfy its dependencies, it works quite nicely :-)
I usually do ~700Mb, and always '2-pass' (takes longer but better quality)
